intro: Hesperis bicuspidata var. cappadocica, commonly known as the Cappadocian honesty, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, white, four-petaled flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and linear, lance-shaped leaves. Native to the Cappadocia region of Turkey, it thrives in well-drained soils and sunny conditions. Its botanical features make it a notable species for botanical gardens and ecological studies.
